thread.title: Conservative Edward Yi He enters General Election race against Keith Vaz in Leicester East | Leicester Mercury
thread.title_full: Conservative Edward Yi He enters General Election race against Keith Vaz in Leicester East | Leicester Mercury

title: Conservative Edward Yi He enters General Election race against Keith Vaz in Leicester East | Leicester Mercury
text:
Conservative Edward Yi He enters General Election race against Keith Vaz in Leicester East By danjmartin | Posted: May 07, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Edward Yi He is contesting the Leicester East seat in the General Election Conservative Edward Yi He enters General Election race against Keith Vaz in... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 1 
The Conservatives have chosen their General Election candidate to take on Labour veteran Keith Vaz. 
Edward Yi He has been given the challenge of trying to overturn Mr Vaz's huge 18,352 majority in Leicester East. 
The 31-year-old Chinese-born candidate is an aerospace advanced manufacturing engineer who lives on the edge of the constituency near Abbey Park. 
He moved to Leicester in 2013 having worked for Tata Steel in South Wales where he took on another high-profile Labour figure, Stephen Kinnock, in the 2015 General Election . 
General Election 2017: Click HERE for everything you need to know 
Mr He acknowledged the challenge Mr Vaz posed but added: "He has been an MP for nearly 30 years and he has taken the people of Leicester East for granted. 
"Now, I think, people are ready for a change." 
Mr He is a trustee at a cancer support charity and has worked in city schools as a STEM ambassador. 
He said his priorities include supporting the Prime Minister Theresa May's plan for Brexit and working to get more affordable and decent housing provision in Leicester East. 
The Mercury contacted Mr Vaz for comment but he has not responded. 
There are so far two other candidates for the Leicester East seat on June 8. 
Special needs teacher Nitesh Dave is standing for the Liberal Democrats and Sujata Barot is standing as an Independent.
